thread.title: Jeremy Corbyn calls for 'pause' for victims of Leicester explosion

author: Linda Steelyard
title: Jeremy Corbyn calls for 'pause' for victims of Leicester explosion
text:
Jeremy Corbyn calls for 'pause' for victims of Leicester explosion Labour leader also praised emergency services Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn paid tribute to those killed in the devastating explosion in Leicester before delivering his key Brexit speech this morning. 
Before outlining his party’s approach to Brexit at a speech in Coventry, he said: “I think we should pause for a moment and send our condolences to those who have lost their lives in Leicester last night.” 
The politician had earlier praised the efforts of the emergency crews working on scene. The scene on Hinckley Road, Leicester, where emergency services are responding to an aparant explosion, Leicester, 25.2.2018 
He said on Twitter: “My thoughts are with the families of the four people who died and those injured in yesterday’s explosion in Leicester. Read More 
“Thank you to the emergency services who are still on the scene and hospital staff who are working to save lives.” Read More
